Description: The Sherwin-Williams Co., ConAgra and NL Industries agreed to pay a total of $305 million in settlement of allegations by the counties of Santa Clara, Alameda, Los Angeles, Monterey, San Mateo, Solano, and Ventura; the City and County of San Francisco; and the cities of Oakland and San Diego, that they manufactured paint products containing lead when its danger to public health was known.

Company: NL INDUSTRIES/TARACORP LEAD SMELTER CONSENT DECREE (CERCLA)
